alert.note: Alert for Caswell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 5:24PM EST until December 17 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Caswell and Rockingham counties in northwest North Carolina, and portions of Henry and Pittsylvania counties along with the independent city of Danville in southwest Virginia. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 522 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall up to a half an inch is expected. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Buckhorn Branch, Cane Creek, Barker Creek, Benton Branch, Buffalo Creek, Big Toby Creek, Burkes Creek, Birch Creek and Benaja Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Danville... Eden... Reidsville... Wentworth... Yanceyville... Bethel... Mayfield... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
